message:update.title: Distro Annoucement
message:update.content-body: Added a feature to the package manager which set the access permissions on some system folders; such as /usr/lib, to read-only on exit.

message:update.title: Distro Annoucement

message:update.title: Release of Breeze::OS V2.1 [amd64]
message:update.content-body: Release of version 2.1 of the Breeze::OS 64-bit GNU/Linux distribution, which is based on the Slackware64 14.2 release. The Xfce [4.12], Mate [1.16], Lxde [0.99.2], and KDE [4.14.3] desktops are offered. The Live DVD ISO will be available for download at https://breezeos.sourceforge.io. Use the script named d-make-liveusb.sh to write the ISO to a USB flash drive. The default Breeze::OS init.d system is now OpenRC. The Breeze::OS installer brzinst, now includes an encryption page, allowing you to setup disk encryption for your installation. It can also be invoked, as just another session, by using our display manager brzdm. The package manager is now, also offered in a self-run package; allowing it to be run independently of the installed packages. You can download it; and execute it in console mode. It is located at https://breezeos.sourceforge.io/distfiles/slackware/amd64/2.1/brzpkg-x64.run A new set of GnuPG keys were generated for this version.
